intro: Oxyacantha punctata, commonly known as the spotted mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Oxyacantha punctata is often found in woodland areas and along riverbanks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
